label: HubSpot CMS API
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the HubSpot CMS API.

tools.name: AddHubdbTableRow
tools.description:
Add a new row to a HubDB draft table.

    Use this tool to add a new row to the draft version of a HubDB table. To make these changes live, publish the table afterwards.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: target_table_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the target HubDB table to add the row to.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: CreateUrlRedirect
tools.description:
Creates and configures a new URL redirect in HubSpot CMS.

Use this tool to create and set up a new URL redirect within the HubSpot CMS. Ideal for managing website redirects effectively.

parameters.name: redirect_destination_url
parameters.description: The target URL to which the redirect will point. This should be a valid and complete URL.

parameters.name: redirect_style
parameters.description: Integer indicating the style of the redirect. Defines the behavior and type of the redirect, such as permanent (301) or temporary (302).

parameters.name: route_prefix
parameters.description: Defines the prefix for the URL route to be redirected. Provide the specific path without the domain, e.g., '/example-path'.

parameters.name: apply_only_after_not_found
parameters.description: Applies the redirect only after a 404 Not Found response if true.

parameters.name: enable_pattern_matching
parameters.description: Set to true to enable URL pattern matching for the redirect. False matches exact URLs only.

parameters.name: enable_protocol_agnostic
parameters.description: Set to true to ignore the protocol (HTTP/HTTPS) when matching URLs. Enables protocol-agnostic redirects.

parameters.name: ignore_trailing_slash
parameters.description: Set to true to ignore trailing slashes, allowing flexibility in URL matches.

parameters.name: match_full_url
parameters.description: Set to true to match the entire URL exactly. False applies partial matching.

parameters.name: match_query_string
parameters.description: Indicates whether the redirect should match the query string. Set to true to match, false to ignore.

parameters.name: redirect_precedence
parameters.description: An integer indicating the priority of the redirect if multiple rules match. Higher numbers take precedence.

    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: url_redirect_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the URL redirect to be updated. This ID specifies which redirect's settings will be modified.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

documentationChunks.content: The HubspotCmsApi MCP Server uses the Auth Provider with id `arcade-hubspot` to connect to users' HubspotCmsApi accounts. In order to use the MCP Server, you will need to configure the `arcade-hubspot` auth provider.

summary:
The HubspotCmsApi toolkit enables developers to integrate and manage content on the HubSpot CMS through a comprehensive set of API tools. It provides powerful functionalities ranging from creating and managing blog posts, pages, and database rows to handling multi-language content effortlessly. 

**Capabilities**:
- Efficiently create, update, and delete blog posts, tags, and pages.
- Manage HubDB tables and their drafts with bulk operations.
- Support multi-language content management across various CMS objects.

**OAuth**:
- Provider: Unknown
- Scopes: cms.domains.read, cms.domains.write, cms.knowledge_base.settings.read, cms.knowledge_base.settings.write, content, hubdb, media_bridge.write
